review:
Like a gentle rain nourishing the roots of a young forest, Zazelenimo brings fresh life to the landscape of civic engagement and open-source innovation. The project’s vision is clear: to empower communities, foster collaboration, and restore the green lungs of our cities through participatory budgeting and quadratic funding. By inviting citizens, NGOs, businesses, and municipal authorities to co-create urban greening projects, Zazelenimo embodies the spirit of inclusive governance and shared stewardship.

The application’s open-source foundation is strong, with transparent code and a commitment to leveraging and contributing to the broader OSS ecosystem. Its integration of Ethereum, Cometh Connect, and the Allo Protocol demonstrates both technical sophistication and a willingness to build upon the wisdom of the open-source community. The project’s partnership with the City of Split is a living example of how public institutions can be gently guided toward more open, regenerative practices.

Innovation flows through Zazelenimo like a mountain stream. The use of quadratic funding to democratize resource allocation, the seamless onboarding of non-technical users, and the thoughtful design of end-to-end project lifecycles all speak to a creative, experimental spirit. The project’s focus on environmental sustainability—urban greening, local stewardship, and long-term maintenance—aligns beautifully with the principles of regeneration and ecological harmony.

Yet, even the healthiest forest has its shadows. The application would benefit from deeper articulation of its impact metrics, especially regarding environmental outcomes and social inclusion. While the technical roadmap is robust, more detail on risk management, scalability, and community governance structures would strengthen the project’s foundation. The absence of on-chain deployer addresses, while understandable at this stage, leaves a gap in verifiability that should be addressed as the project matures.

In sum, Zazelenimo is a promising sapling in the ecosystem of open-source civic technology. With careful tending—greater clarity on impact, governance, and transparency—it can grow into a mighty tree, offering shade and sustenance to many. Let us encourage its growth, while gently guiding it toward deeper roots and broader branches.

strengths.title: Strong Community Participation and Multi-Stakeholder Engagement
strengths.description: Zazelenimo invites citizens, NGOs, businesses, and government to co-create and steward urban greening projects, embodying collaborative governance and valuing diverse voices.

strengths.title: Innovative Use of Quadratic Funding and Web3 Integration
strengths.description: The project leverages quadratic funding to democratize resource allocation and integrates Ethereum, Cometh Connect, and Allo Protocol for secure, transparent, and user-friendly participation.

strengths.title: Open-Source Commitment and Ecosystem Contribution
strengths.description: Zazelenimo is fully open-source, both using and contributing to existing OSS projects, and serves as a practical case study for OSS adoption in the public sector.

strengths.title: Environmental Sustainability and Regenerative Focus
strengths.description: The platform’s core mission is to foster urban greening and long-term stewardship, aligning with regenerative principles and the interconnection of environmental and social wellbeing.

weaknesses.title: Limited Articulation of Impact Metrics and Outcomes
weaknesses.description: The application lacks detailed, measurable indicators for environmental, social, and community impact, making it difficult to assess the depth and breadth of its regenerative potential.

weaknesses.title: Insufficient Detail on Community Governance Structures
weaknesses.description: While multi-stakeholder collaboration is emphasized, the mechanisms for ongoing community governance, decision-making, and conflict resolution are not clearly described.

weaknesses.title: Scalability and Risk Management Not Fully Addressed
weaknesses.description: The roadmap would benefit from more explicit strategies for scaling to new cities, managing operational risks, and ensuring resilience as the project grows.

weaknesses.title: On-Chain Verifiability Gaps
weaknesses.description: No deployer addresses or on-chain objects are provided, limiting transparency and the ability to independently verify the project’s blockchain activity at this stage.

changes.title: Define Clear Impact Metrics and Evaluation Plan
changes.description: Articulate specific, measurable indicators for environmental, social, and community outcomes, and describe how these will be tracked and reported over time.

changes.title: Detail Community Governance and Decision-Making Processes
changes.description: Provide a clear framework for how community members, partners, and stakeholders will participate in ongoing governance, including mechanisms for conflict resolution and adaptation.

changes.title: Expand on Scalability and Risk Management Strategies
changes.description: Describe how the project will address challenges related to scaling, operational risks, and maintaining resilience as it expands to new municipalities.

changes.title: Provide On-Chain Verification Details as Project Matures
changes.description: Commit to publishing deployer addresses and relevant on-chain objects as smart contracts are deployed, enhancing transparency and trust.
